intro: Rubus vanoverberghii, commonly known as the Vanoverbergh's blackberry, is a species of bramble native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, dark purple berries that are typically harvested in late summer. It thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil and partial shade. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
